unit_learning_outcomes.description: Show awareness of differences and similarities between language use in their native language and the target language, as well as thoughtful understandings of how to negotiate difficulties that arise during cross-cultural and/or cross-linguistic interactions.
Express nuanced understandings of how language and culture interact, and evidence ability to apply the target language to solving real-word tasks.
Skillfully interact and/or work with others to accomplish tasks, build communities, and collaborate with people from diverse backgrounds
Increase their ability to clearly express, detail, defend, and/or promote ideas in public situations, both through their native language and their target language.

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: Students will produce reflections about their experience based on thoughtful reflection and logs of their activities during the project, and engage with the online iLearn community.
Students will produce reflections about their experience within their groups based on thoughtful reflection and logs of their activities while studying, and engage with the online iLearn community.
non_scheduled_learning_activities.offerings: Session 2-Infrequent-North Ryde, Winter vacation-Infrequent-North Ryde, Session 3-Infrequent-North Ryde, Session 1-Infrequent-North Ryde

assessments.description: Students will produce a video wherein they discuss and reflect upon their experiences during the placement. The video should touch on an issue relating to what the student has learned, how they overcame challenges, how the experience related to their overall program of study, and the ways in which they will employ what they learned in the future study and/or community engagement. Additionally, students should discuss their preparation for the experience, and how this impacted their time during the project. The backup supplementary task for this assessment task is a project diary discussing the experience.

Students will produce a video wherein they discuss and reflect upon their experiences during the placement. The video should touch on an issue relating to what the student has learned, how they overcame challenges, how the experience related to their overall program of study, and the ways in which they will employ what they learned in the future study and/or community engagement. Additionally, students should discuss their preparation for the experience, and how this impacted their time at the host institution. The backup supplementary task for this assessment task is a travel diary discussing the experience.
assessments.offerings: Session 2-Infrequent-North Ryde, Winter vacation-Infrequent-North Ryde, Session 3-Infrequent-North Ryde, Session 1-Infrequent-North Ryde

assessments.description: Students are required to satisfactorily complete the components of their approved program of study. The backup supplementary task for this assessment task must be an equivalent program or experience, arranged by the student with the host institution.

Students are required to satisfactorily complete the components of their approved program of study. The backup supplementary task for this assessment task must be an equivalent program or experience, arranged by the student with the host institution.
assessments.offerings: Session 2-Infrequent-North Ryde, Winter vacation-Infrequent-North Ryde, Session 3-Infrequent-North Ryde, Session 1-Infrequent-North Ryde

data.subject_search_title: INTS2090 - International Studies Intermediate In-Country Cultural Studies

academic_org.value: Department of Media, Communications, Creative Arts, Language and Literature

data.description: This unit is offered on a pass/fail basis and designed for students who wish to complement their academic program through a short-term intensive program relevant to languages offered in Languages and Cultures. This unit facilitates study through a partner university where intensive learning will take place in the student’s through the partner institution will be approved and promoted by Languages and Cultures Discipline in collaboration with Macquarie International. The short period of intensive study is intended for students already engaged with issues of language and culture in their course studies. Participants will be selected for the program based on their application, suitability, and the relevance of the program to their degree.
data.search_title: INTS2090 - International Studies Intermediate In-Country Cultural Studies
